intro: Osterdamia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Native to regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Osterdamia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its propagation.
